column2: 1. Preliminary Activities – Permits, Documentation, Approvals, Survey Documentation
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawing is being used including the Subcontractor’s copy. Current revision to be obtained via Aconex.
Reference Documents - Drawings and drawing registers on Aconex
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Work area has been cleared and surveyed (marked on site). Limits of work clearly defined.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria - Details of proposed grooving machines to be submitted to Contract Administrator for approval.
Acceptance Criteria - Pavement to be thoroughly inspected and in an acceptable and suitable condition for grooving prior to works commencing.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Trapezoidal grooves must be:
– Nominally 6mm deep by 6mm wide at the bottom and 12mm wide at the top and spaced evenly at 57mm centre to centre
– At true 90 degree angle to runway and taxiway centrelines unless indicated otherwise
○ Around in-pavement light fittings, grooving must cease maximum 450mm from centreline of light in all directions.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Grooving works must be as per the following allowable tolerances:
– Spacing to be evenly spaced, no less than 54mm and no more than 60mm centre to centre
– At surface - must not be less than 11.5mm and not more than 15mm
– At bottom - must not be less than 4.5mm and not more than 8mm
– Depth must not be less than 4.5mm and no more than 8mm
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Contract Administrator to witness measurement of groove dimensions
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - Progressively during works and after

Acceptance Criteria - Grooving machine must flush the grooves of  all slurry during grooving process. Any residual slurry must be removed using high-pressure water in combination with hand or mechanical sweeping. Slurry must not be allowed to harden in the groove.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Frequency - At each of each work period
Acceptance Criteria - Contract Administrator is notified of completion of cleaning of pavement surface
Record of conformity - This ITP signed

On behalf of Fulton Hogan it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
